page.title: 12Felsted Public School
page.content:
Felsted School was founded in 1564 by the then Lord Chancellor of England (Richard, Lord Riche) and the original building is still in use as the Art School and Book Shop. Today there are about 450 boys and 56 fifth form girls at the school and all except about 30 boys are boarders and live there during term time, paying over Â£5,000 per year for their education. There is also a Junior Preparatory School which takes about 150 boys aged eight to thirteen years.
Together the two schools employ over sixty teachers plus numerous domestic and ancillary staff. The school has excellent facilities, many of which, such as the swimming pool, drama and music halls and book shop, are available for use by the Local community.
